kou commented on issue #4018: ARROW-3578: [Release] Fix RAT spurious failures
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4018#issuecomment-476460785
 
 
   I looked into this. This is caused by hard link in tar.gz.
   
   I wrote a Ruby script to list non file/directory entries in tar.gz:
   
   ```ruby
   require "zlib"
   require "rubygems/package"
   
   Zlib::GzipReader.open(ARGV[0]) do |input|
     Gem::Package::TarReader.new(input) do |reader|
       reader.each do |entry|
         case entry.header.typeflag
         when "0" # file
         when "5" # directory
         else
           p [entry.header.typeflag, entry.full_name]
         end
       end
     end
   end
   ```
   
   It shows the followings for apache-arrow-0.12.1.tar.gz:
   
   ```text
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/cpp/cmake_modules/FindArrow.cmake"]
   ["L", "././@LongLink"]
   ...
   ["L", "././@LongLink"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/CompilerInfo.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindLLVM.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindArrowCuda.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindGFlags.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindThrift.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindLz4.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindParquet.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/Findjemalloc.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindSnappy.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindGPerf.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/SnappyConfig.h"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindFlatbuffers.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindClangTools.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindZLIB.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/UseCython.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindPythonLibsNew.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/BuildUtils.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindGTest.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindGLOG.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindZSTD.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindGBenchmark.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindBz2.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindInferTools.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindPlasma.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/san-config.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindProtobuf.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindGandiva.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/SnappyCMakeLists.txt"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindNumPy.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindRE2.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/SetupCxxFlags.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindArrow.cmake"]
   ["1", "apache-arrow-0.12.1/python/cmake_modules/FindBrotli.cmake"]
   ```
   
   "L" typeflag in tar means the next entry has long name. So we can ignore it.
   
   "1" typeflag in tar means hard link. So we can remove needless entries from `rat_exclude_files.txt` by resolving hard links. We can do this by `--hard-dereferences` option in GNU tar. (But BSD tar doesn't have the option.)
   
   So this fix isn't suitable. I'll create a pull request to resolve hard links.
   
   @fsaintjacques Could you open JIRA issues for `release_hash` and `dev/release/source/Dockerfile` and resend pull requests for them?

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Something about the untarring / retarring process is offending Apache RAT and it's reporting a number of unapproved licenses incorrectly

https://gist.github.com/wesm/490dc50c494cc914ae28b4fd897a73eb
fields.summary: [Release] Address spurious Apache RAT failures in source release script

comments.body: Seems this could be caused by https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2417
Run the source release script. It fails here: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/release/02-source.sh#L114
Are these symlinks in the tar? At least `cmake_modules` were a symlink once that created these problems.

Caused by the prepare script: [https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/release/00-prepare.sh#L147-L171]

On the release branch the rat exclude file is updated, and the 02-source.sh uses the updated exclude file, not the one which belongs to the release.

 

Here is the boundary: [https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/release/00-prepare.sh#L141]

So We need to run RAT with the exclude file within the archive.
These are things that are symlinked to in the archive. It probably depends on what comes first.
